unnormalised: Mumbai - Bollywood's churning out more movies than your aunty makes biryani for Onam! This week sees a clash of the titans, or at least, a clash of mildly successful actors trying to look like titans.
normalised: Mumbai - Bollywood's churning out more movies than your aunty makes biryani for Onam! This week sees a clash of the titans, or at least, a clash of mildly successful actors trying to look like titans.

unnormalised: First, we have "Prem's Pranay Pariksha," a rom-com starring Varun Dhawan trying to win over Kriti Sanon. Critics are already calling it "another 3 hours they won't get back."
normalised: First, we have "Prem's Pranay Pariksha," a rom-com starring Varun Dhawan trying to win over Kriti Sanon. Critics are already calling it "another three hours they won't get back."

unnormalised: Then there's "Action Avtaar," Arjun Kapoor's latest attempt to convince us he's a believable action hero. Sources say he trained for a whole 2 weeks, running approximately 5 km a day.
normalised: Then there's "Action Avtaar," Arjun Kapoor's latest attempt to convince us he's a believable action hero. Sources say he trained for a whole two weeks, running approximately five kilometer a day.

unnormalised: Rumour has it, Karan Johar fainted upon hearing the opening day predictions for both. Trade analysts are predicting collections of around Rs. 20 Crores each, which, in Bollywood terms, is like finding a Rs. 10 note in your old jeans.
normalised: Rumour has it, Karan Johar fainted upon hearing the opening day predictions for both. Trade analysts are predicting collections of around rupees twenty crores each, which, in Bollywood terms, is like finding a rupee ten note in your old jeans.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Shabana Azmi was spotted at the National Film Archives demanding they preserve better movies. Ouch!
normalised: Meanwhile, Shabana Azmi was spotted at the National Film Archives demanding they preserve better movies. Ouch!
